headline: Fine
pros: Good hours, yearly bonus, job security, most managers are pretty good and have your back
cons: Certain branches severely overworked, constantly short staffed, promotions based off of favouritism, drastically change policies on a whim without consulting employees, horrible covid response

headline: Searching
pros: Work Life balance and work environment
cons: Low salary range and very little training

headline: Good Place to gain some work experience.
pros: Very friendly work environment, all the co-workers are supernice and on the same page.
cons: Not many cons, maybe the only one is the lack of upward mobility.

headline: Cool
pros: Small office provides close knit work environment.
cons: No cons that I would like to mention.

headline: Overall an okay experience as I knew I was not staying here forever
pros:
Coworkers are generally nice
Flexibility with school schedule
cons: Toxic environment (have heard this be a problem at many of the branches)

headline: Review
pros: Time Flexibility and movement opportunities within organization
cons: Compensation not up to par

headline: Not the best culture
pros:
Caring branch staff 
Solid growing bank
cons:
Take advantage of staff
Not enough pay
Too much reliance on staff

headline: Teravision It’s a Great Place to Work
pros:
New Tech 
Team Work 
Great environment 
Trust 
New and Challenging Projects
cons: Young Company that need Improve organizational structure!

headline: Horrible, racist, SHUT THEM DOWN
pros:
Good Starting job
Potential for growth if you stay in you lane
cons:
Harrassment
Racism
Scandals
No proper Human Resources (Private Company)

headline: Former Employee Review
pros: Opportunity to gain experience and exposure
cons: Lack of communication and cohesiveness

headline: Work life balance
pros: Very good work life balance
cons: There are no cons I can think of

headline: Good
pros: Fun environment, not super strict
cons: Poor pay, not too proactive on promoting anyone

headline: Political
pros: great people, laid back atmosphere, good work life balance
cons: no room for growth unless you kiss up to management, politically charged

headline: It’s not what you know it’s who you know
pros: 9/10 the people you work with here have the same mindset, mangers are great and the people you meet here are genuine and sincere. If you’re in college second or first year this is a decent start for a business major.
cons: Like the title says, it’s not your knowledge of the banking industry that’ll get you promoted, or your degree it’s getting into the click/group. You can be here for 5+ years and at most you’ll move up a once on merit alone if that.

headline: Okay Job
pros: BCB Bank is a small bank and you can easily get to know everyone fairly quickly if you are social. The employees I work with are pretty cool. Management worked with my school schedule.
cons: If you have connections to upper management, that is how you will move up. It's more about whom you know than what you know. There is a high turnover rate because of poor management. Can turn into a toxic environment.

headline: Stay far far away
pros: They will entice you with a higher pay but it is like cheese in a mouse trap
cons: Holidays - they do not recognize 4 federal holidays (even the govt is off)/ Nepotism - if you are related to the CEO / board member(s); you could kill someone and still be employed/ Senior Management - clueless, distasteful and surprising inept/ Lack of Communication / Hierarchy non-existent/ Medical Benefits - HORRIBLE/ Just stay far far away and do not fall for their gimmicks in the hiring process

headline: Horrible place to work
pros: 20 PTO Days, Med Ben ok, but keep changing & cost doubled
cons: Everything else. hours, pay, very few holidays, extreme mean girl culture, acute favoritism, pitiful training, very, very poor management

headline: Teller
pros: Ummmmm... yea, about that. You get 20 days of PTO. That’s literally the only benefit to working here. If you’re looking for more pros out of a company, I highly suggest you look elsewhere.
cons:
LONG hours, no yearly raises, pathetic amount for a yearly bonus, low pay, favoritism among senior management, corporate office is disorganized, high turnover, horrible management and hostile work environment, horrible systems, lack of communication between corporate and retail, nepotism, etc.

Don’t have enough time to list everything wrong with this “bank”.

headline: Universal Banker 1
pros:
Not many... benefits, pto, some holidays off
Off a sat once in a while. Paid for travel and expenses , free shirt and food
cons: Terrible training, low pay, favocrtizim, long hours, outdated systems and no respect from upper management..will not use them as a reference nor will I refer anyone to them

headline: #metoo
pros: Very familial culture, made some great friendships and company seems to be growing.
cons: Stay away from CEO if you’re a female. Avoided making eye contact or shaking his hands at various events throughout my time  after being propositioned by him a few times. I know I wasn’t the only one and many feared for their jobs if they said “no”, reported it (He basically runs HR) or didn’t flirt back (there goes that raise or promotion).

headline: Bank Teller
pros: Great experience if it is your first time in a banking environment to learn the basics.
cons: Very poor training and the management places a premium on customers over employees. The hours are difficult and they are not very lenient or flexible with scheduling.

headline: Under appreciated and under staffed
pros: Decent amount of vacation days, meet lifelong friends, good place to start out, accommodating to school/kids schedule, office is quiet for the most part
cons: Understaffed, not appreciated for all the work you do, only see what’s wrong and not your accomplishments, favoritism, bad pay

headline: underwriting
pros:
Good work/life balance
great co-worker & working culture
cons:
CEO is quite dogmatic
Low bonus

headline: BCB Review
pros: Not so busy, good staff,pay
cons: disorganized, boring at times.

headline: Not worth working for over the age of 25.
pros: Great for high school kids or young adults going to college full-time.
cons:
-Favoritism
-No raises in over 5 years, unless you are a "friend" of Tommy
-Extremely overworked
-Unfair salary pay
-Incompetent front line staff, giving bad information to customers

headline: Teller
pros: Promotes internally, pto, and not a stressful environment. Most other banks have quotas unlike bcb. Upper management is easily accessible and are always nice. If you work hard they will promote you fast.
cons: Doesn't really have much cons besides pay. Because of low pay there is a high turnover.

headline: Avoid at all costs
pros: None that I can think of
cons: Where do I begin, from the BOD to all levels of Upper Management, this institution breeds back stabbing, empty promises and most importantly a culture of inefficiency.

headline: Beware
pros: Great health benefits and certain people are trust worthy.
cons: Bank plays favoritism starting from the president.  You get to move up if he likes you or if you do favors.  They don't compensate hard work, upper management will not survive in real world as all positions have been bribed or votes fixed even board members.

headline: Not worth it
pros: great coworker's, great hours, overtime available if doable
cons: Poor management, low Compensation and too political.

headline: Extremely Political
pros: Paychecks never bounced, good salary.
cons: C-level management works on the "good ol' boy" system, and the current CEO (Tommy) runs the show.  Lots of backstabbing, backdoor deals that get broken more than they're upheld, and empty promises.

headline: Decent
pros: Growth potential, hires from within, small bank, upper management is reachable, adequate semi thorough job training, decent company to work for
cons: Long long long hours, only major holidays off, very cliche, needs to cross train all employees, update bank system, lots of paperwork, better employee incentives

headline: Teller
pros: You make a good amount of money.
cons: Long hours, work weekends and holidays with mediocre pay, a lot of favoritism by higher level employees

headline: Great Potential for Growth
pros: I like working close to home and interacting with people I know from town.  The bank is very involved in the community, and that was a big draw for me.  I always see their logo on all of the kids' sports teams.  The bank is also big on hiring from within and helping employees grow. There are always job postings for different positions, and many managers have worked their way up from the branches. I like knowing there are other opportunities for me if I want to leave the branch. There is a good health plan.
cons: It is a small bank and does not always have everything that Bank of America or TD does; it can be difficult to explain that to customers who don't want to hear it.  Customers can be hard to deal with in general at times.  The dental isn't that great.

headline: Great working environment and nice people
pros: work and life balance, nice co-workers
cons: low pay, employee turnover rate is high

headline: Extremely poor management
pros: CEO SEEMS like a nice guy. Nice work hours, no weekends for me at least. They hire and allow advancement from within the company first before looking outside.
cons: I've never worked for a dept that was as poorly geared as this one. For such a growing company it's still driven on horses and carriages. They have such outdated standards and procedures and refuse to listen and change with a more modern process. Welcome to working with type writers instead of the internet. Sad when you have to forget how things run in 2014 to how things ran in the early 90's to work for a mediocre company. I understand backstabbing is also in every company but the amount in the hr dept especially hearing about sensitive information is ridiculous.  I am glad I don't work here anymore because it's a sad environment.  Also, I am wary about working under a manager who is also vice president of an important dept who is as clueless as this one.

headline: So much potential.... If only the company really cared...
pros: Great place to start a career to gain experience.
cons: Great co-workers and the customers are wonderful with the exception of a very few who think they can get away with anything and everything because "they know someone". Rules are constantly being broken depending on the customer or employee.

headline: Bad Management bad attitude of employees.  Does not encourage comraderie.
pros: Live in the neighborhood. Walking distance.
cons: Bad management. Bad attitude of employees. Bad customer service.

headline: A good local community bank
pros: flexible, friendly, reliable, good employees
cons: poor wages, not enough days off

headline: Horrible Bank to Work at.
pros: Small Community Bank  easy commute
cons: Poor management especially loan administration and loan closing. Management very clickish and will discuss personal information about other employees to subordinates

headline: Horrible place to work
pros: If you live in the Bayonne/Jersey City area it is easy to commute to.  Good start job for high school or first time job seekers. Branch managers are great people to work for if it was not on this company.
cons: You are hired as part time but work full time with no benefits. There is always someone getting fired or leaving. No way to advance unless you are family or friend of someone in a higher position.  Always fear not given that special customer what they want because they will call a board member and get it done even if it is against policy, which will in turn cause you to get reprimanded.
